snippet: The department has placed further limits on how officers should respond to fires after issuing guidelines just a week ago.
abstract: New York City Police Department bars officers from using elevators in burning buildings and recommends they not enter smoke-filled hallways; order comes on same day that Police Officer Dennis Guerra succumbed to smoke inhalation suffered after he responded to building fire in Coney Island on April 6.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: The department has placed further limits on how officers should respond to fires after issuing guidelines just a week ago.

headline.main: New York Police Department Tells Officers to Avoid Elevators in Burning Buildings
headline.print_headline: Police Told to Avoid Elevators During Fires
